Event.name: Precariousness
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Theme</fen> has the potential of falling from its current <fen>Location</fen>, which would likely result in damage.
<ex>Now, <t>balanced</t> <fex name="Manner">easily and firmly</fex>, <fex name="Theme">he</fex> stood on the ledge outside in the slight, chill breeze.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">A ball</fex> will sit there <fex name="Degree">perfectly</fex> <t>balanced</t> <fex name="Location">on a jet of water (or air)</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Theme">Joey</fex> <t>teetered</t> <fex name="Result">into him</fex> <fex name="Time">sometimes</fex>, losing his balance from extreme exhaustion. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A valuable entity which might fall and be damaged.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A modifier expressing the deviation of the actual level of precariousness from the expected value given the <fen>Theme</fen> and the state indicated by the target itself.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Falling_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>The event of falling, incorporated in the LUs of this frame.</def-root>

Arg.name: Dangerous_entity
Arg.definition: <def-root>An entity which may cause the <fen>Theme</fen> to fall. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A particular location in which the <fen>Theme</fen> is at risk of falling. Frequently, it is to be inferred that the characteristics of the location put the <fen>Theme</fen> in danger.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Theme</fen> is in danger of falling.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the state of precariousness of the <fen>Theme</fen> logically follows.</def-root>

Arg.name: Situation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Situation</fen> under which the <fen>Theme</fen> is safe or unsafe from falling.
Most expressions of <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen> also express the <fen>Situation</fen> and should be labeled as such on the 2nd FE layer.</def-root>

Arg.name: Domain
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> in which the <fen>Theme</fen> has a degree of precariousness. Usable only in metaphorical sentences.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the <fen>Theme</fen> as being in some state during the action. </def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A <fen>Frequency</fen> expression answers the question how often.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Duration</fen> denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the holistic properties of the balancing situation.</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event or state that results from the instability of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: teeter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be likely to fall, usually due to slight motion in an unstable position.

lexUnit.name: balanced.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: be in a position that would lead to falling, if it were not for the preciseness of the placement

lexUnit.name: unsteady.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not steady or firm; shaky

lexUnit.name: stability.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state or quality of being stable

lexUnit.name: stable.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not likely to fall or give way; steady in balance or position

lexUnit.name: steady.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: firmly placed or fixed; stable
